system.description: May they be an appraiser of rare magic items, peddler of illicit substances, or bookkeeper for the court, merchants are masters of exchange.

features.name: Gold Sink
features.description: You gain the Deft Hands Perk, and can take the Use Action to place nonmagical valuables into a container and close it. You can then open that container to replace the valuables with an Item of equal or lesser value to the valuables placed in it. This Item can't be a Relic or similar magic item.

features.name: Deep Pockets
features.description: You have an extra number of Item Slots equal to (half your Merchant Level, round up).

features.name: Bang for Your Buck
features.description: When you use an Item with limited uses, you can spend 1 Luck and roll a d10. If the result is lower than your remaining Luck, the Item is not expended.

features.name: Diamond Hands
features.description: You can spend a Shift to remove one Power from a non-Fabled Relic or expend valuables in your possession of equal or higher value to the Power to add it to an Item.

features.name: Treasure Seeker
features.description: You can sense gold, gems, and Relics within Near as if by Telepathy. This sense is specific enough to tell you where they are, but not exact specifics about the Item(s).

features.name: Bang for Your Buck II
features.description: Your Bang for Your Buck Feature now uses a d8 instead of a d10.

features.name: Top Shelf
features.description: Once per week, you can pull a Relic from your Gold Sink Feature with a value no higher than (your Merchant Level x 20g), otherwise obeying all the rules for using that Feature.
